page.title: 12Story of the valley. page 1
page.content:
This story has been handed down,father to son for generations. It is the story of how this small valley below the ancient celtic hill fort of Moel-y-Gaer arrived at the names given to the fields, farms and slopes.
There was once a{Prince called {Llewellyn.}His base was at Moel_Y_Gaer, the hill fort, and he ruled all the surrounding lands.They put{marker stones}up to the fort and there are three stones. There is one at Graig-Ddu (black rock), and another at Bwlch-y-garnedd (the pass of the cairn), the third stone has not yet been found.
